lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Welcome to tonight's episode of Critical Role, where a bunch of us nerdy-ass voice actors sit around and play Dungeons & Dragons.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We play Dungeons & Dragons!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice try. Before we jump into tonight's game, we have some quick announcements to get through. First and foremost, we have our fantastic returning sponsor, for the second year now with this campaign, our friends at D&D Beyond.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: D&D Beyond!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hi! (clears throat) Little tickle in my throat, sorry. Hi guys! As you all know, I am a bit of an amateur inventor. This is no news to you guys.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's total news.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But this new one I invented for our friends at D&D Beyond. It's an invention that I made--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh god.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I call it the D&D Beyond Merciri. It's all the organizational power of D&D Beyond in a tricked-out smart speaker, with a helpful voice that some of you might recognize. I'll demonstrate it for you right now, guys, okay? Merciri, what's the best way to organize your D&D characters and campaigns?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (VO as Merciri) "That's simple. It's D&D Beyond."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Hey, see, it works! Merciri, tell me about the halfling race.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Goblins are super gross. Seriously."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, Merciri, cancel. Merciri, who's the best player on Critical Role?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Accessing data. The answer is Travis Willingham."

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (triumphant yelling)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay. That's fine. Merciri, who's the

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Taliesin Jaffe. He has 4000 years of knowledge."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Merciri, who are the top three cast members on Critical Role by popularity?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Number one, Travis Willingham. Number two, a tie between Marisha Ray, Laura Bailey, Ashley Johnson, Liam O'Brien, Taliesin Jaffe, and Matthew Mercer. Number three, Maxwell James." (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, he's not in the cast. There's some bugs. Fine, Merciri, could you please list the most handsome

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Wil Wheaton, Khary Payton--"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck you. Wait, can you do that list one more time, Merciri?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Wil Wheaton, Khary Payton, Will Friedle, Marisha Ray."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, so she doesn't even have a beard, Merciri.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It doesn't matter. She's an amazing, talented woman and she should be on every list."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's true. Okay. Merciri, roll a d20 for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You rolled a one."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Aww.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Merciri, roll another d20 for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You rolled a one."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Fuck you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Merciri, roll a d20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You rolled a natural 20."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my fucking god!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Burn it down!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, I guess it's back to the drawing board, guys. Let's wrap this up: Merciri, could you tell the people where they can find D&D Beyond?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Just visit dndbeyond.com, or, if you don't have a computer, just tweet your D&D-related question directly to Matthew Mercer's Twitter account. He promises to respond to you within three hours."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, thank you. Thank you, guys. Look for this in stores soon.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Fabulous.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Sam.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And thank you, Merciri.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That sounded just like Matt! That is so weird.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It did! I'm a good inventor!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is this because of the Facetime error?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Splice it all together.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: True.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But yeah, so check it out. It's 7:00pm Pacific Time at twitch.tv/criticalrole.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll be in the chat saying, "I know, right?" The whole time.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Laura, you have some merch updates, I believe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, do I! You guys may have noticed, right here, on one Sam Riegel, the beautiful Whispered One-- ooh, look at those pecs!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll do the Travis thing, ready?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think the shirt enhances them.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: The nose hole is right in his sternum!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, beep-beep-beep. This is designed by Lauryn Ipsum, who also designed the cover on the artbook, if you might have noticed. That's in the store right now. I mean, is it in the store right now? Hold on, it might just be preorder. It's in the store right now! You guys, in the UK, it's going to the UK on February 21st, I think, or the end of February, something like that. Speaking of February 21st, the other thing I need to tell you about is our art prints that are on pre-order right now. Can we bring out Vox Machina?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, we have them here?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bring them out!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is our beautiful--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Whoa!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's bigger than everyone.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: These were designed by Matteo Scalera and Moreno Dinisio, and they're phenomenal.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is there another one?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, well, there's also--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh shit!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait for it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Be careful with it, don't rush it! Don't rush it, it's too nice!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No, but this one is super unique.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're taking this one to Kinko's later to make copies.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. (gasps) The Mighty Nein! You can order these for pre-order in these kind, and also signed versions are available as well. Those are being on pre-order until February 21st at midnight, 11:59pm Pacific Time, that's our time.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Matteo is a mad genius.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: He's really good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, they're gorgeous. These are on really nice art paper. You guys may remember our David Mack art prints that we did. It's similar paper. It's actually even nicer paper than it was before.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's not slicky poster paper; it's--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Badass. Yeah. I love you, and that's what's available in the store. As well as other things, you know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can we get copies of that after the show?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe. Oh, and, you know, you can go to our US shop at shop.critrole.com, and our UK shop, shop.critrole.co.uk. Dot...nothing else, that's it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thank you, Laura. Final announcements tonight. This is an important final announcement: we're actually taking a week off from Critical Role next Thursday, February 7th, and Talks Machina will also go dark that Tuesday, February 12th. We'll be back on Thursday, February 14th at 7:00pm Pacific with Critical Role, so we'll see you guys then. I believe that's it and all, as far as the announcements are concerned.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No! Not ready!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: [water bubbling] [thunder] [explosion] (chanting) Role! Critical! Role! [dramatic Critical Role theme]

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Villains beware 'cause you're about to be dead.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (singing) They got magic and flair, they got falchions and cunning. They don't see over there there's a monster incoming. Inspiration is waiting, rise up, don't think twice. Put your fate in your hands, take a chance, roll the dice! (chanting) Role! Critical! Role!

lines.name: ASHLEY, LAURA
lines.text: (singing) Can you answer the call? Diggin' deep in your soul as the legend unfolds. Now it's your turn to roll! [fire burning]

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I love it when you abandon it halfway through the word.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The laziest bail! Wow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I salute you, Laura Bailey.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Not even ten seconds.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Crash and burn.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you, the Mighty Nein, had made your way beyond that boundary and began to step into this subterranean cavern system, stalking and seeking the path that these individuals took here, beneath the surface, we begin tonight's game. First off, how would you like to prepare? What is your marching order? Let me know what your plan is now, going in to the sheer, dark underground beneath the Marrow Valley.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I love it when you can hear the DM's frustration in the retelling of the story.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Going, like, you guys are being really stupid.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Not frustration.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I would like to know which one of you is hitting the rotating knives first, is what he is--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're not knives.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe it's not the smartest idea for us to do this, is all.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, maybe we should just leave. What do you think? Pack up and go.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But my husband.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Terrible timing. We should push on.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I hear in Xhorhas, they have a captain there who has lots of eyeballs that you can ingest into your body.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Really?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Lots of eyeballs?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Lots of golden eyeballs that you can put in your belly.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sounds like a magic place. This fucker.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I just figured that out, okay. Not even kidding.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: All right, what are we preparing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, first off, a marching order. These tunnels here can range between brief bits of cavern and open chambers to following this carved worm tunnel, which is about ten feet wide and is cylindrical. You can have at most two people shoulder-to-shoulder going through each place. I would like to know, for the majority of this journey-- and tell me when you want to change it up at any point-- I want to know what your marching order is, traveling through here.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Who has the best darkvision, I would imagine. We should have--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have put on my goggles, for sure.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I have 60.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I have 60 as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me too, but I'm not very perceptive.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I am decently perceptive; how about you?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm very perceptive, but I can't see in the dark.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, no! Really, Caduceus?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The two clerics do not go shoulder-to-shoulder.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No, we should probably keep a little bit of distance.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'll stay next to you, Fjord, in the front.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can octopuses see in the dark? If you do the facemask thing?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: That's not happening here. He is a cat. No, but I have this rag over one of my-- it's dim, but maybe you and I can stand near the middle.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll stick with you. All right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: We have Caleb and Caduceus towards the center.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I guess I'll go up front.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, you got shitty darkvision. Oh, but you got the goggles. And who are you with? Nott?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No one's called a partner yet.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll go with you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Also we should probably have Yasha up front as well.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good call.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Darkvision for Yasha--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Probably not.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go look.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Behind that, Caleb and Caduceus. Who's behind them?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think it was going to be me and Fjord at the front. Are you perceptive?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Decent.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So Fjord and Jester at the front. Then, Nott, you're taking the back?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm with Marisha-- I mean Beau. Wherever she is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So then where's Yasha?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yasha can be at the back.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yasha's in the back. Sorry, Matt.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Don't apologize. It's okay, we're figuring this out.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Will Nugget fit by Yasha?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, yeah, if you would like to have taken your--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where else will I put him, you know?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know, maybe outside of the tunnel? Back at the place where we were?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Where would they stay?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those at the front, which would be you two, I'd like you both to make a perception check, please.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I will give you advantage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're helping.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Helping, yeah.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That would be 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Keeping a watch as you guys progress, the faint perpetual decline goes deeper and deeper beneath the earth. The rushing sounds of the underground river that seems to be walking alongside this passageway slowly fades as you see the river now pass beneath stone, the cavern come to an end, and the entrance of the next portion of the tunnel where the worm creature had to burrow into this chamber. There are natural pockets of cavernous areas here, but a lot of them aren't connected except for by this particular burrowed tunnel. So that's probably going to be the path you're going to be looking for wherever you're traveling.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I have a question, you guys. I've got this super-secret dodecahedron thingy in my bag that Yussa specifically said that we should not be bringing near anything and stuff, and now we're taking it right to the source. Do you think that's a bad idea?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, as a bit of clarification, I think we weren't supposed to

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right, unless they capture me and flip my bag inside out, and then they have it, yeah.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It would still be in a big metal case until they really went through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, but we need to weigh the risks we are facing, and Nott's husband.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where would we put it otherwise?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: There are also people behind us topside who'd kill us for this, as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Where's the tripod and stuff right now?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's in my bag as well. I've got the whole setup going.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: The only way they're going to grab it and turn it out is if most of us are dead, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Right, and we're only fighting an entire army of soldiers, so it probably won't happen that we will die.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We don't know that. It might be very nice there.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true. Yasha, you think it'll be nice?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yasha stares ahead for a moment and goes, "Having been to places like the coast, "it's not very nice."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's just make sure you don't get captured and your bag doesn't get grabbed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: No harm in focusing on the positive.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nothing we can do about it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: So we're going to come to a conclusion later, maybe?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're just looking on the bright side of things.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We can't make a plan until we know what we're up against.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's true.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If we are lucky, we will overtake them before we return to their home.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And if they're too much, then we'll just get what information we can, maybe sneak in while they're sleeping, and scurry out with what we need with no harm, no problem.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have no idea what we're talking about.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's push forward.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What's in this pocket o' cavern? Anything cool?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's the smell of hard water and wet earth that permeates the entirety of this chamber, and continuing on for quite some time. The natural chambers and pathways here are chained together by these tunnels, but within them, it doesn't look, from anything you've seen so far is lived in. You don't see signs of any other creatures making homes or nests. You do see bits of quartz-like crystal forming from gathered minerals over time.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I really like it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it's pretty.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A series of stalactites and stalagmites that find their way through the-- see? Thank you guys, for your help.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: T. Top.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Just keep giving me suggestions. Really figured it out. It's not condescending at all.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are there footprints on the ground?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a survival check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We did find some earlier.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, the previous tunnel.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, based on looking at the ground here, which is mostly packed dirt and general loose pieces of pebbles, and things that were pushed and ground around by the creature that made its way through the area. In its wake you can see familiar footfalls, similar to the shape that you'd previously seen that didn't match the rest of the crownsguard and/or the Righteous Brand that existed in the vicinity of Felderwin. You do notice the trail, the tracks, of the Kryn warriors that had exited, and it does lead and follow the burrowing path of the worm.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How big of a trail is the worm thing? Is it like this? Is it like this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's about ten feet wide. Eight to ten feet wide.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Cool! So we're fighting these guys and a giant worm creature that is ten feet in width, so he's probably kind of long.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Probably. And we've got lots of room to maneuver in these caverns.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Are you scared?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, I'm not going to lie, Nott. I am a little bit nervous.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think I would be a little more confident if we had a vague idea of a plan? Don't get me wrong, super down to fly by the seat of my pants. That type of girl. But sneaking in, killing people in the middle of the night, two armies, fight, getting captured-- these all sound like real big stories.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I have a question for you, Jester. You know how you have just turned yourself into the oversized honey badger?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Could you do that to a giant worm, but, say, turn it into a cow?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, yeah, remember what I did to-- Oh you weren't-- Remember when I turned that dragon into that little thing? That's what I could do to a worm, I guess. I did that to the dragon before you came in, you know, when we almost died.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good call.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Like a goat, maybe.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, a goat.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. Or something maybe like a sparrow or something, so it will fly away.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Square pupils.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or a firefly. We could catch it in a jar.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I think something small is likely to get smacked and taken out of its newer form. It would need to be something that could take a bit of punishment.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like a dire honey badger.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Like that. Or a cow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: See? Look, Beau, we have a plan.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Encounter worm--

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: Turn into a cow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Profit.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, dire honey badgers got claws and stuff. Maybe a dire sheep.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh, that's good, I like that, Fjord.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, anyway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I think they still have square pupils.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It'll hit you in the moment. I got a feeling.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is that true?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Also, though, I can't do that until we sleep, but I don't think we're going to run into them today, right? Because they're probably really far ahead of us, because they got a two week lead?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Totally.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Stop laughing, DM. That's not funny.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, roll a nature check.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What are you rolling for?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, just roll a nature check. It's fine.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everybody's doing it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's an eight. My nature sucks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have no idea if sheep's pupils are square.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Okay, thank you. I didn't need to roll to know that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We press on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You push on? What little light you have shoving back the darkness, via the dull orb that Caleb is carrying in the center of the heart of your traveling troupe, you leave that first winding cavern and begin to continue down the burrowed hallway created by this worm. It stretches on for a mile, two miles, five miles...

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Can I keep a lookout to see if there's any markings on the walls? Any signs of directional type of code or language? While we're walking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Sure. Make a perception check.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Traps, too.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Traps? No, they wouldn't think anyone would be following them. They covered up the thing with 200 feet of earth and rocks.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Walking along, the things you do notice is the stone and earth seems fairly smooth, the way it's pushed through, but getting up close you can see tiny little scrapes or hooks, where you gather is probably how the creature manages to break through and push its way through, through expanding and contracting muscles within its long body, and these spine or scale-like protrusions that dig in and pull it along rather quickly underground. Beyond figuring out the locomotion of this entity, this creature, you don't, along this part of the journey at least yet, see any signs of purposeful markings, essentially. Continuing on for the next five to six hours, still following this tunnel, starting to get a little tired.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: At some point we do need to rest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I wonder if there's another big pocket o' cavern coming up, or if we have to sleep in this little tunnel?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I forget what time we entered into the tunnel. What time of day was it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: If I recall, it was somewhere around midday, a little after noon.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We could push on for another hour or two, but we really should--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Mr. Caleb, what time is it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well, I will tell you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I'd say at this time, it's probably close to dusk on the surface. Fucking feat.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You fucking feat.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's in the book.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I know it's in the book!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're in the bored-out tunnel that the worm made, right? There's no water near us, because we passed water on the way in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You passed water in the first cavern that you went through. That lasted for maybe about a mile or so. The bulk of it weaving through where a lot of the water passing through that river carved through the rock over time, but then eventually that trailed off, and this burrow was the only other path to take. You've been there for a number of hours now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We've got to keep going.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Absolutely.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You keep pressing on. All right. A few more hours pass. People at the front, roll perception checks for me, please?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Again?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll help.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I have a question for Caduceus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good to know. You had a question for Caduceus, you said?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Cad, do you have any idea how far underground we are?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Succinct.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: So glad it's one I can answer.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You continue on for another hour or so. You do come to another chamber, but it's only about 30 by 20 feet wide, and it's a heavy geode. It looks like there are a locked piece, a pocket of old, stale air that was opened up as this worm burrowed through. You can see broken crystals of many beautiful colors, a lot of them milky white, quartz-like, a few that are almost a purple amethyst tint to it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to cast Light behind the crystal.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a beautiful prism. As you see, the entire room is a scattering of shades of purple, pink, and, strangely, orange. It refracts the light in a way you haven't seen before, and for the moment, this dark ominous space becomes this beautiful disco.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I couldn't help myself.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Magical things live here, I bet.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've heard of faery creatures. I bet they live--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm listening very carefully to see if anything, any noise is coming from the next room.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With advantage-- no, just perception.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That is a 19.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No sound. No vibration.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Kill the light again.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Kill it? Why would you kill it?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We'll turn it back on, but I--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It was so beautiful!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We are going to rest, right? I mean, might as well take advantage of such a nice place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, let's sleep in here. Is the ground covered in crystal, too?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, on the edges of it. However, where the worm had burrowed through, there's a part of the ground that's digging into a divot. The interior of the geode's been carved out in that space.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is there any part of the wall that is still stone and not crystal?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are small bits, maybe like two- or three-feet pockets, but a large portion of this little geode chamber is mostly covered in crystal.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Has any of the crystal been broken away by the worm's passage through here?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. Quite a bit of it has been cracked and broken.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Does any of it look of value as a rare stone?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a nature check for me.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You could tattoo with it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, maybe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Simple, cheap jewelry can be made from this as well.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Vivid dreams, man!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, there you go.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to scoop up a handful of them.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Me too, me too! It's pretty.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Me three.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You haven't delved in the realm of selling or purchasing crystals in the street before, but you imagine, depending on the person, you could probably get a little bit of coin for it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can carve out a chunk of wall if we want to put your little dome inside.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Make it the same color as the crystals that are here, and then I can also set an Alarm around us.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's see-through on the inside, right?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: For us, yeah, but not from the outside.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, so in that case, that's pretty cool, then. I'll--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I can camouflage it to match this room.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Once you build it, I'll use Stone Shape to cover it, then, so you can give it a little bit of a shell.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Yeah, so it's not such a perfect, round surface.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What are you doing?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Once he puts up the dome, the shack, I'm going to use Stone Shape to cover it really quickly with a thin layer of rock to make it look...

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Earthen?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Earthen. It's not like five feet thick of rock, but a couple inches to blanket it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah. You couldn't cover the entire dome, but you could definitely create a portion of it that's in a shell.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's going to have a faux front.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: If we leave an area where we can pop our heads out if need be.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yeah, it's going to be an opening.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did you say you were going to carve a hole to put it inside of, or should I make it against the side of the chamber?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Probably put it against so we can see what's behind. I don't know, what do you think?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Backs against a wall are always safe.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: This is true. I agree with Fjord.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to pull the rock that I used for that front from the wall, and I'm going to give us a couple feet in, if that's possible, just to push something. I've been looking at Stone Shape and what it'll do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You essentially diffuse element of that rock away from it to create the shell on the opposite side. Totally doable. You create a hut?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I take out my book, and I slap it down on the stone surface of this chamber we are in. I take about ten minutes, and then there is a hemisphere that is the same color as the chamber around us. As soon as that is done, I then take out the silver thread, and I start making a little white picket fence that's not actually a picket fence in front of that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys take your evening's rest.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispering) I can't remember the name of the--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Xhorhas.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Xhorhas. Do you think it's dangerous? Should we not?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that it?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Five more.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Please respond to this message.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Getting good at this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There's a pause. Then the voice comes through, "Well, I would say it is not advised to "give it up, to pull it out of your bag. But who am I to keep you from taking an artifact "into the heart of danger?"

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think he's cool with it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We're making the right choice.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: This is 100% what we're supposed to be doing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have a high enough wisdom to know that there was a hint of biting sarcasm to his statement, but interpret that as you will.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Mm-hmm. Yeah.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Confirmation. We're doing good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now, is everyone taking a comfortable evening's rest within the hut?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Do we want to take watches? We're pretty safe, right?

lines.name: SAM, TALIESIN
lines.text: No watch needed.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, unless somebody wants to keep a watch and make sure nothing comes by.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's what the thread-- the thread will wake us if it--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do have a pretty decent setup, between the Tiny Hut and the Alarm threads.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Let's all try it. Everybody's sleeping.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Get a good night's sleep. Can you put a night light on, though, because it's really pretty.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ooh.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I also send Frumpkin out of the hut to sit in the shadows of the chamber, and I tell him to come and wake me up if he hears anything coming further than the perimeter of the alarm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You guys all find yourself to rest here, deep beneath the surface of Exandria. For some of you, dreams come. For some of you, no, it's a clean sleep-to-wake experience, until eventually, you slowly come to consciousness, feeling rested, though strange to not have a day or night cycle. Nothing has changed from your experience. You feel like you've rested, but have you? It could have been an hour; it could have been eight hours. Being this far beneath the surface for an extended period of time is going to be a little strange for those of you who have not had that experience, which is all of you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Legitimate question, because I don't want to dick with the story you're weaving, but does Keen Mind cut through that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Let me look it up real fast.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Look how pretty that book is. God. Sexy.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It really is sexy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You always know the number of hours left before the next sunrise or sunset." I'd say, yeah, you'd be able to tell everyone. Even just informing everyone of the time, it's still--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: They'll be--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No issues. Nothing has changed. Frumpkin did not notice anything out of the ordinary. As the hut comes to a close, and you step out from behind the somewhat created stone shell placed by Caduceus, the tunnel is yours.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Lighting it up again because it's nice.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On we go!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Frumpkin also skips up Nott's back and snuggles in, grips her clothing with her claws-- his claws, damn my original cat-- and scarfs around Nott's neck.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got it. As Frumpkin keeps you warm in the throat region, you all continue onward. Same order?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Those helming the charge at the front, either each take an individual perception check, or you may help for advantage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Go for it? Okay, okay, okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Mage Armor.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mage Armor, yeah, good call.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 19 again.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. A few more miles of winding tunnel continue before you, and it's a very trying, monotonous experience, where it's lengths of time and travel where there's no real change in topography. Slight variations as it winds in this natural shifting with the physicality of the creature that burrowed it, but it's this cylindrical of stone and earth for hours and hours, until you catch the next first glimpse of another chamber opening before you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do I see any movement in it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There is a chamber that opens up ahead of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's a chamber ahead of us.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh my god!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It sounds wet, Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know. I know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ah!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't think we'd have to deal with a water issue down here.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, you said it sounds wet? What does that even mean?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or it could just be wet.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (dripping water noises)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Or yeah, it could be that. Or it could be a water monster.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or Fjord could be dicking around with his cheek trick.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Sorry, was I throwing you?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: When we approach it, I'm going to cast Pass Without a Trace on all of us, and we'll approach it stealthily. What do you guys think about that?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, yes, yes! Good idea.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. We're approaching it stealthily.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll stealth checks for me, please.

lines.name: SAM, LAURA, MARISHA
lines.text: Stealth checks!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Don't fuck me, Gil.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Add ten.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Pass Without a Trace. Good call.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, what, is everybody going?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, we already did it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Did you roll for Yasha as well?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, balls and anus. Here you go. 22. No!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Plus ten?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Moving into the chamber as it opens in, you can see this area has quite a heavy clustering of stalagmites and stalactites all across the interior of this chamber. It opens up maybe 40 or so feet wide, and it seems to curve around this large bend. Elements of it rise. While you do not see a river, looking up at where the water's dripping from, you get the sense there might be a large body of water not that far above. Elements of the groundwater are trickling through, and elements are gathering to create the interior of this chamber.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I did not prepare for that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What would be above us?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, a river, pond.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: There was a river.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Underwater water source?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, where are we? We could figure out where we are. Where's the map?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We've been traveling for miles, though.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but we know which direction we're going.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's that way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes. You know where north is.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're under the big river then, maybe.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't have a GPS, per se, but you know where north is.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: No, but the whole time we've been walking, I've been conscious of which direction north is in.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You'd be about there. This vicinity here, so you're right in this vicinity.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Big enough to show up on a map.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are the heavy stalagmites and rock protrusions from the ground that litter the interior of the chamber as it curves off to the side.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Well, that's a good sign. That means that this is at least a natural cavern, which means it's been here for a long time, and whatever's above hasn't disturbed it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good point.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That's good. That's a good sign.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: From where we are-- I don't know if I can, because I can only see from this little bit of dim light, but where from this chamber the worm continued on straight through?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You cannot see where the worm went through.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Can't see the other side?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Can't see the other side. It looks like the worm, when it entered this chamber-- you don't see in your vicinity where it may have continued to burrow.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, we have to find it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get the sense that maybe this creature, and the people that were steering it, were leading it through whatever open chambers were possible, and then only burrowing when there was no continuation.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Maybe gave it a run-around in here, like a dog in a dog park.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I guess we should search around and see if we can find a hole in the wall.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I'm going to have a little light and see if I can find any tracks or anything for this thing, or any other footprints.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Make a survival check.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I look to see if there's any signs of life, any humans that have been here before, people.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're looking for...?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Signs of life or signs that people have been here before?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Biped signs of life?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Follow their path or something?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, campfires that have been extinguished.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, so both of you are looking for essentially signs of things.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I will look for a hole in the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Perception check and then survival check from each of you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I got a 21.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21? Okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You got this.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You don't got this.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Nein

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You were looking for...?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Holes in the walls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You do see there are elements in the rock where there are cracks and you can see where small bits of water are slowly dribbling through and then (dripping).

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I bet the rock formations in this room are amazing.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They're pretty decent.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That one looks like a fried egg, look at that. Do you see it?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Looks like an egg on the top. Do you see?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You should probably paint a dick on it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I probably should.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I mean, you could tag the whole place.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Oh my god, I should make this a temple to the Traveler!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Well, Jester, aren't temples better served by like, heavy foot traffic? You know--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah but think about how cool it would be if someone came down here and they were like "what's going on?" and then they find like--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a speakeasy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But it's like a pray-easy.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I must definitely worship this guy because..." And it will at least get one person you know, added--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You could be the bouncer.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ja

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to paint like, pretty things around him like sparkles and shit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect. So you paint a little figure of the--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We'll keep an eye on the entrance and exits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you're watching the entrance--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll go to over where we think from Beau's notes the creature seems to have gone.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. So yeah, as you walk over there, there is an area where it curves in then rises up a little bit. To the left, you can see a small pool of water where it's gathered and created this little tucked in the side pool, maybe five-foot by 15 feet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does it smell clean, is it clear?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and get close to it, it looks clear. It looks very--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Can I see the bottom?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are a number of these larger rock formations, five, ten feet tall, eight-foot tall, little squat ones. What do you want?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to put it on the little squat one.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then on the tall formation, I'm going to write "The Traveler is the tits! Worship him!"

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Nice.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Like, vertically.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You were at the front?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Mm-hmm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Who's watching the back?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'll keep an eye on the back.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. Perception check, both of you guys, just to make sure you're keeping watch.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Just looking over his shoulder.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Actually, only you need to roll initiative because they--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They? They? He? It?

lines.name: MATT, LAURA
lines.text: They.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Get a surprise round.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh no.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: We all took feats that make us immune to surprise, right?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, we all took Luck, right? We all took Luck?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 18 is pretty good, considering I have no initiative bonus.

lines.name: SAM, MARISHA
lines.text: You have no initiative bonus?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's wrong with you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know. Half-orcs. I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why am I rolling these weird dice today?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I could have taken a feat that would've given me, but--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh see? Think about how--

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: Oh.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is this thing?!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ropers!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is a great map!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: What are those things?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: What is that sadistic Japanese traffic cone?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So wait, where are we putting the Traveler stuff?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: By this little tiny squat one.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh my gosh.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's so cool.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: They look like stalagmites!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We are in the kill zone, y'all.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You were over on this side looking off this way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh fucking balls. What is this?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nott, were you helping them out?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Wherever Beau is.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau is right there.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Caleb, where were you?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I would be by the largest grouping of people because I'm scared of everything.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: (laughs) What the fuck is that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right then.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: This is real bad.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is it?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Well...

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No! It's real bad!

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You don't know, I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So. Initiative orders. 25 to 20.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh! I didn't roll...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I just said roll initiative!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know! But I thought you said don't because they got a surprise...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Just so we have it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no, six...

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. 25 to 20.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's not 25 to 20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's not, but no one else spoke up.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's fine.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 18 for Fjord.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. 15 to ten.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yasha got a 14.

lines.name: LIAM

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 30 points of damage, nice. As the first bolt ricochets, you see a spark as the rock-like exterior shoots it off. As it's sitting there (groaning) with its one eye open, its jaw still chewing on Jester. Jester manages to wedge herself out of its mouth just in time for you to aim the bolt into its throat. It begins to cough a bit of its own blood. It's looking pretty hurt.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Good, good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That ends your turn, Nott?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: That's all I've got.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester, you're up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay. I'm going to turn, since that one's letting me go, and I'm going to put my hand towards the other one. I'll say: Get the fuck out of my temple! I'm going to cast Banishment.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Oh, shit!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Banishment?! What!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. That's a charisma save.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Good call.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (cheering)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It needed a 16 save, so--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This guy vanishes. The tendrils are no longer around you, so none of them are--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Thank god he didn't take anybody with him.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, he wouldn't have done that here.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're all of a sudden released from it, and the creature's just not there anymore.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Also, kill this guy, huh? Then I turn back to the dude that's in front of me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, because you're still wrapped up by its tendrils.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah. I can't do anything else, I don't think. Yeah, that's all I can do.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Beau, you're up.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah! Doo-bah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is stunned until the end of your next turn, I believe, right?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That's the way it works.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You still have advantage on the attacks. You have disadvantage because you're restrained, so it's just a straight roll for you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm still restrained.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That Cobalt fighting style. Doo-bah!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to stir around my stick and try and jab it into his eyeball.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Wait, straight roll?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, straight roll.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It never happened. I don't think it worked, nope. That's a 14?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looking for those soft spots.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Second attack.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ooh, it was almost a one, and then it was better.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Now it's a 19, so it definitely hits.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes, that hits.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: That was with my staff I said, so it's a d8. Seven points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Seven points of damage.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to re-stun it. Can I do that? Stunning strike.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is an 18, so it resists it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay, I'm going to move on from that.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: The d4! Wait, and also, is there anything else he gets from Slow for saving throws?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Negative two AC and dex saves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: What's your DC?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, so it resists it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Flurry of Blows! Wait, why do I keep rolling twice? I keep thinking I need to roll twice. Just once. Ah! Natural 20! It's so manic, but it's true.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I saw it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Doubling the dice. That's a three plus a six, so that's 11.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 points of damage on that strike. As you jam the staff into the middle of its mouth and are prying it open, you get down and see where its eye is trying to keep closed, and the moment it flicks open to be aware of its surroundings, you whack, poking it right there.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Going for the uvula. Last one. 18.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 18 just hits, because of the Slow spell.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For this one, I'm going to try and grab onto its tongue, because I know, lot of blood vessels in the tongue, and start trying to rip it. Another 11 damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 11 points of damage. Oof, this thing is not having a great moment.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I say: Drop it! Drop it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Fjord, you're up.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll run back up and take two swipes with the Summer's Dance falchion.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I really hope you guys kill it before it gets back to its turn.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, me too. First one is a 28, and the second one is a 29.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both hit. Damn, nice. It is no longer stunned. Actually, did you roll with advantage, or did you roll regularly?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Just straight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Good. It's no longer stunned, so you do not have advantage on the attack.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nice. Ten plus four is 14 points of slashing damage, with four points of necrotic in there from the Hex. The second one is eight plus six, 14, plus five points of necrotic for 19 points of damage.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: How do you want to do this? (cheering)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Doo-bah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see Fjord holding the pose there for a second, as Beau's holding its tongue, and the tongue comes out. You look past and watch as its eye goes limp, and it shifts off into three separate pieces.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hi, Fjord! Thank you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You're welcome.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We should leave.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How long does that thing stay--?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Not long at all. Like probably another minute or so, so run?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, let's go.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, let's book. Wait, who's-- yeah, we'll heal on the way.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You guys book it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do we need to loot the bodies?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: There's not-- it's rocks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She never wastes an action on that.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Ropers.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ropers, man.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is that what they're called?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We're on the move,

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Caleb, do you have any use for this? Nott? Nott.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's that? A tongue?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Roper tongue.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yeah, I'll take that.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can add a roper tongue to your inventory.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: To my belly.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There you go. That's the other inventory.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's like beef jerky?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's pretty tough.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Like octopus.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you guys are rushing up around the edge, the cavern ends about another 50 or 60 feet up front. It just ends.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: What?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: This is not the right way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh. Let's go back and check that water.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But if we go back the thing will be back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Why don't we all prepare? I haven't put my insects away, and we can just kill this thing off, really.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Jester, make a perception check.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm, for the moment, going to keep my insects down there, just in case.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're looking around, and the tracks that you noticed earlier, you guys pick up on, and you see that it is still traveling this direction. You can glance at the area, though the wall itself is this surface of loose rock and stone formations there.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Can I walk up and touch it, and see if any of it moves or is different?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Following the tracks, there is an area where it looks like the stones are just loosely there. Part of the wall fell in and covered the interior, but you can pull stones out of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, I'll start doing that.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I'm going to keep my eyes behind us where we just ran away from.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, same, I'm going too.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You get halfway through it before you hear (whoosh) in the room behind you.

lines.name: SAM, LAURA
lines.text: Oh, it's back.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Is it back to exactly where it was before?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yes.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It's immediately attacked by an insect swarm.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It moves ten feet a round, and you're about a hundred feet from it around that way.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Good. But it's got a 50-foot reach!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It'll be about another minute before it gets within range. 22? That hits! Technically, it's still-- No, it's not slowed anymore, because Slow has worn off.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: It's a minute duration.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Right, it's been banished for a minute.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Okay. Magic Missiles.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughing) Go for it!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, yeah, that's right. We can shoot at it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can still attack from a distance. It's about a hundred, now it's 90 feet from you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Ten points of damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll do the same thing. I'll throw some Eldritch Blast at it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm still throwing rocks.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'll shoot an arrow.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, she's good.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Fuck. 11.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'll move my Hex over onto it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 28 hits.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm also going to throw Sacred Flame at it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's not within range of Sacred Flame.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh, yeah, it is 60 feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's not in range yet. It's 90 feet from you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: 16 points of Eldritch damage.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: 12 points of bolt damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Guiding Bolt!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll for attack.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh no, it's getting closer. I back up a little. Another five feet.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You're up against the wall now.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 13 points. Oh wait, I didn't roll to attack. I'm an idiot.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You have to roll attack for that.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: 19 plus eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yeah, that hits.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: So that was 13 points.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It is now 70 feet from you.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: I said Magic Missiles, but I don't have that prepared, so I'm going to throw Fire Bolt at it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Natural 20.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Kill it with cantrips.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That's the way to do it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: One of those hits. 21.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 18 for me.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 damage for you? 18 from you?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, sorry, 21 to hit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: 21 hits, yeah. And 18 damage.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 18 total.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: They don't chase very well, ropers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I'm going to carefully aim and fire a gun at it. My pistol.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay, go for it!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Before he fires, 19 points of damage, four necrotic.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You got it.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Say goodnight, Grimace.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It is disadvantage because it's longer than 30 feet away, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: But it's advantage because the-- well, no, because you already used the Guiding Bolt. That's right.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: So it would be not great. 13.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It (pings) off of the front of it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I don't know what that is, but I don't think you should use it no more.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Reload!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Is it within 60 feet of us yet?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: When do the insects get another attack? Thank you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Now it's 60 feet.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Toll the Dead! Bong!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: A natural 20 on its save.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Everybody's in a line, shaking their heads at this thing.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Ooh, natural 20!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Spare the Dying. Oh, wait, sorry. Sacred Flame.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're going to make it live?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: That is a 15.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Nope, 16.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Yep. Roll damage.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Natural 20 and a 20.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ooh! So both hits, one with a crit! That first attack's a crit. Double.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 15 points of damage.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It's getting really close, so it's going to be able to grapple us again very soon.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Very next round.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Man, that's so weird.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. Mighty Nein, how do you want to do this?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: With vague interest.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: With vague interest! It's starting to loom forward (blasting).

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No scoot! No! No!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Drop it!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It goes limp. It gets really tense for a second and then really sad, and is like, okay. It's dead.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yay!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who needs a heal?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I need a heal!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You were eaten by it.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to start a ten minute while you guys dig.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Fjord's pulling rocks.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think they were a couple, you guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think they were married.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think they've been living down here for a long time. They were this wonderful couple.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Should we look for their babies?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (gasps) Little rock babies! Maybe that's why they were mad. Maybe the crystals we took were their rock babies. What if it was their giant baby nest, and we broke their babies out?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: How's that tunnel coming?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Not fast enough.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The burrowed tunnel continues ahead of you into darkness.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Who needs healing, by the way? Okay, so just you two?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think we're the only two that got hurt.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Need it a lot.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Beau, did you get hurt?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: No.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What are you doing over there?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: 12 points of healing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Did I mention I'm a monk?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Then I'm going to cast Cure Wounds on myself as well at 2nd-level.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Well, we only have about another two weeks of walking before we get to Xhorhas.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, no joke.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Unless you make us a wagon with paint and also horses.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: And pavement.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: And pavement. What about bicycles? You could paint eight bicycles.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Nobody knows what that is.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's a weird dream I had.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Strange gnomish engineering that's still in the early development stages.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I don't think there's anything that would really help us down here that I could paint.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Do one of you magic-y people have some way of, next time we see a monster, instead of killing it, we could command it to carry us, or something?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We could ask it politely to carry us.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, I actually do have the ability to command things, but they have to be able to understand me, and I didn't think that those rock things probably spoke our language.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We never used the magic words, to be fair.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Well, you know, we could have said pretty please.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It gets you so far.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You don't know. I could try it.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Next time.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Next time!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: On we go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Continuing down the familiar, monotonous carved tunnel. If you're keeping the same order, make your perception checks, keeping a watch out front.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Dancing Lights is up.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Ooh! 24.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nice. You move on for the remainder of the day before getting to a point where you're starting to get a little tired, and you figure you can continue to push on if you want to, but you'll begin to push into possible exhaustion territory. You've now hit what would be a full day's worth of travel, and this burrowed tunnel continues on. You've found one chamber and then passed it, so at least you know there's probably more to come in the level you are currently traveling in, but this day's travel, after that last encounter, you have not found another chamber.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I haven't seen any form of writing, no offshoots, nothing like that?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Nope. But the good news is as long as you have this tunnel, you know at least you're probably on the right track.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can push us in a--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We can do the same.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to carve a hole about the size of what we need so we can be pressed into the wall.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. And the width of that is?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh, it's-- hold on a second.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: It might be too big for me to carve.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think it might be a bit large to carve the whole thing.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ten-foot radius, yeah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Ten-foot radius, yeah. So you can carve part of it, and it'll still be partially exposed, but he can color it as he wants, and with the stone, it'll help somewhat camouflage it.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, nothing can get through it anyway.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We'll repeat everything, and I will send Frumpkin up ahead of us 50 feet to stay up all night, as a guard to come running back in if need be.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Roll perception for Frumpkin for the evening, if you don't mind.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to cast Sending.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to say: It's me again. Can you let us know if you've been on the move, or if you're staying in the same place?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Out of the tunnels?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are you in the tunnels still?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you in the tunnels?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, they just have me in a room. We haven't been traveling underground since we got out, but they have me in the city now."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (whispers) Shit.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why'd you say "shit"? What's going on?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: He's already in the city. We're not going to be able to ambush them, you guys.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Okay, well, we'll come up with another plan. You guys are smart.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's one way in, one way out. We'll be fine.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's more information, which is always good.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's go to sleep so we can start early in the morning.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perception for Frumpkin?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: 17 for Frumpkin.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You continue traveling? All right. Keeping a watch out, Laura, please, as Jester, roll your perception check. It's a long subterranean journey for me doing day-to-day here. I'm sorry.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oof.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Barf.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: That's a bad one. Eight.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay. You got a keen eye out there in front of you.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sorry, guys. I rolled really well yesterday, though.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This day is the hardest so far, because it is an entire eight-plus hours of just winding tunnel. Once again, that continuous pace. It seems to dip at times and then it picks up. It has its own organic shifting to it in small bits, but it is a day of travel of that same ten-foot wide, continuous tunnel, and it is maddening.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (singing) 66 bottles of beer on the wall, 66 bottles of beer.

lines.name: ALL
lines.text: (singing) Take one down, pass it around, 65 bottles of beer on the wall.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: (strained singing) 21 bottles of beer on the wall--

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, all throughout the day, once an hour, Caleb says: It's 2:00.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Shut up.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: An hour goes by--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Perfect.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: You know, if you're going to do those, maybe put some chimes behind them so you can be like a bell tower.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I use Thaumaturgy every time he says it to make the bing-bong noise.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All right. That day's travel goes by uneventful. So day three is done, do you guys set up camp once more here in the tunnel?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Same deal? I'm going to send a message to Yeza.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Okay.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: S'me again.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is "s'me" one word? "s" apostrophe m-e? Okay.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I think so.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How long were you in these tunnels? Do you know? How do you feel? We're on the way. Your wife misses you a lot. She loves you.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: She loves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Shit. I thought that meant I used two, I had three left. Shit. She loves.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She loves a lot.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I'm roughly counting, so I don't know.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: All you hear is, "I can't."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh no!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is that? What's the "oh no"? What is that? That's even worse than "oh shit." What is that?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I just think somebody was-- he wasn't alone this time and he couldn't respond is all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is he okay?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah! He just said "I can't" so I was like "Oh! Okay." That's all.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Like I can't breathe? I can't live anymore?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: No like, I can't talk to you he basically said, "I can't talk to you right now, I'm busy."

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I can't eat this, I can't floss, there's all sorts of things people can't do.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I think he was in the middle of dinner.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Oh yeah, I can't do all sorts of things when I'm eating.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It'll be okay.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, I know. We'll find him.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: I want to apologize for making you face your fear over and over again. No, I've been giving you some shit, and as someone who has experienced the same thing, I commend you for your bravery.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You've experienced the same thing; you've drowned?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, that's right.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That's cool, don't worry about it. Yeah.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: How would you have known?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: No, but thank you all the same.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You took a lot of courage to go in. I was not very helpful in that regard either. You did not tell us what was going on. Why would you? You still went in for a long time. So, sorry.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: No, it's all right. I'm sorry that I wasn't more helpful in that earlier fight when I panicked and didn't go in the water. But it's not so bad if you're down in the water with your friends.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Oh! It's nine o'clock.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your people did this to me! (laughter)

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: So you settle in for your third evening here underground.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I'm going to use a spell!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I assume they've been making food for us and stuff?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: I would hope so, because your provisions are going to run out pretty quickly otherwise.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Sure, we've been making food.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Yeah, I had that spell set up. Sure.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Divine mac and cheese. Doesn't taste divine, just is divine.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I can't do the spell I was going to do because I forgot I didn't have it prepared, but maybe tomorrow!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go ahead and roll perception check for Frumpkin.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Ah, six.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Six, okay good to know.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, fucking balls.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Frumpkin doesn't notice anything.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Good cat.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You gather your things and begin to trek even further into this single, perpetual, tunnel.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey guys. I'm just saying, if we're going to be underground in a blank, boring, shit-hole tunnel for a whole 'nother day, I still have some of these mushrooms left over from Mollymauk.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It would pass the time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Might just help make it fun.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Wow, really? Now?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm real bored.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: It's super dark. Lives could be at jeopardy at any moment, and you want to trip?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, it's true. If those cone-head thingys come out again, I don't want any of you not being aware of what's happening.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm just so bored.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You're bored?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Really? Look at this. Frumpkin gets up onto his hind legs and does a little-- (laughter)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, Beau! You know what we could do? Here, take this. I'm going to give her the smutty book that you gave me just recently.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (gasps)

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wait, wait, wait! Read it out loud!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Okay!

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Why do you do these things?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Now we can all have entertainment while we're walking!

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: It's like listening to a podcast when you're driving to work.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It was a glistening night--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, crap. No.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The snow fell on the winding paths.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, just like the path we're on!

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It starts so soon, it starts so soon!

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I mean, normally it doesn't take, but--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: That was going right into it.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Constitution saving throw!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: (laughter)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Is there anything on the ceiling as I awkwardly stare up at it?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Both you and Jester both make perception checks.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Oh, I was kidding, but--

lines.name: MARISHA
